info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 8:01PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Brunswick, western Columbus, northern Horry and northern Marion Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 801 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chadbourn to near Rains. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Conway, Mullins, Horry, Tabor City, Loris, Chadbourn, Bethel, Fair Bluff, Hickory Grove, Homewood, Freeland, Adrian, Nakina, Gapway, Bughill, Rains, Southeastern Community College, Williams, Goretown and Galivants Ferry. This includes SC Highway 22 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
